questions.title: One of the essential minerals in the human body is salt. How much salt (NaCl) is in the average adult human body?
questions.feedback: The average adult human body contains about 250 grams of salt, which is just over half a pound. If you don't have enough salt, your body suffers an electrolyte imbalance called hyponatremia.

questions.title: Water-based liquids can be described as acidic, neutral, or basic, with respect to pH. Which of these describes milk?
answers: Milk does not have a pH
questions.feedback: Milk is close to a neutral pH, but it's slightly acidic thanks in part to the lactic acid it contains.

questions.title: What is the most common isotope of hydrogen?
questions.feedback: Most of the hydrogen in the world is protium (one proton, no neutrons), but some deuterium and tritium occurs, too. Tritium is radioactive. Deuterium is not radioactive and is the form of hydrogen found in heavy water.

questions.title: You can't live without water! What is its chemical formula?
questions.feedback: You didn't miss this one, right? Water is good old H 2 O!

intro.header: Intro before moving onto the next question
intro.body:
Chemistry is the scientific discipline involved with elements and compounds composed of atoms, molecules and ions: their composition, structure, properties, behavior and the changes they undergo during a reaction with other substances.

Chemistry traces its roots back to the ancient study of alchemy. Chemistry and alchemy are separate now, though alchemy still is practiced today. All matter is made up of the chemical elements, which are distinguished from each other by the numbers of protons they possess.

I saw in a dream a table where all the elements fell into place as required. Awakening, I immediately wrote it down on a piece of paper. â€• Dmitri Mendeleev.

questions.title: Three of the most common states of matter are solids, liquids, and gases. A liquid has:
answers: A definite shape, but no defined volume
Water isn't a state of matter
correctAnswer: A defined volume, but not a defined shape

questions.title: Are the states of matter
questions.feedback: A state of matter is one of the distinct forms that different phases of matter take on. Four states of matter are observable in everyday life: solid, liquid, gas, and plasma.

questions.title: A mole contains Avogadro's number of items. What is Avogadro's number?
questions.feedback: Avogadro's number is huge! The reason chemists use 6.02 x 10^23 to define a unit is to avoid having to work with incredibly large numbers.

questions.title: Noble gases are inert because they have completed outer electron shells. Which of these elements isn't a noble gas?
questions.feedback: Chlorine is not a noble gas. It's one electron shy of a full octet, so unlike the noble gases, it's highly reactive.

questions.title: All of the following elements are liquids around room temperature except which one?
questions.feedback: Bromine and mercury are liquid at room temperature. You can melt gallium in the palm of your hand. If you put pure magnesium in your hand, it may react with the water in your skin and ignite, but it won't melt.

questions.title: What do you call an atom that has more protons than electrons?
questions.feedback: If an atom has more protons than electrons, it has a net positive charge. This is a cation, which you can remember because the "t" in cation resembles a "+" sign for positive.

questions.title: Complete the following setences with the correct response
answers: Is one of the essential minerals in our body
Scientific discipline involved with elements and compounds composed of atoms, molecules and ions
Elements considered to be inert because they have completed outer electron shells
Carbon dioxide is a molecule with the molecular formula of

questions.title: If you fill a glass to the brim with ice water and the ice melts, what will happen?
answers: The glass will over flow as the ice turns to water
I'll never find out because I'll drink the water or walk away before anything happens.
The glass begins to shatter as the volume increases
The level of water in the glass will remain unchanged as the ice melts
correctAnswer: The water level will drop slightly as the ice melts
questions.feedback: One interesting property of water is that it achieves maximum density as a liquid, not as a solid. So, ice is less dense than water and floats. When it melts, it becomes more dense. More mass per unit volume means the level of the liquid drops slightly.

questions.title: Mark Twain wrote about which of these characters?
This character says, "Please, sir, I want some more." Who is it?
Who was the main character in J.D. Salinger's "Catcher in the Rye?"
Miguel de Cervantes is not the author of 'Don Quixote'
Which best describes George Orwell's "Animal Farm"
Which is the "Scarlet Letter?"
Which person penned the Harry Potter novels?
Which story by Edgar Allan Poe has the main character confessing his sins because of a noise he's experiencing?
